summary:
Currently focusing on circular neighborhoods and systems with organisations such as ESA, Border Sessions, and Municipality of Amsterdam.

Formerly I was an educational researcher involved in various projects and topics including open education, instructional design, peer-based learning, online communities, and education for marginalized groups.

My dissertation focused on the use of web technologies to provide engaging learning opportunities for at-risk youth. Among other things, it provides a set of guidelines to support the development and implementation of student-centered pedagogy for early school leavers in non-formal education. A list of publications can be found on ResearchGate (search for me).

Previously, I consultant and designer of social online platforms at Dutch Coast, an innovative tech company in the Hague. I was also involved in the renovation of a school building (from 1912) in Amsterdam, and responsible for sustainability / energy aspects. The combination of two PV-systems, high-quality insulation, and heat pump systems (and no gas), resulted in a building that is 85% self-sufficient in terms of energy-use.

education.field_of_study: Systems Engineering, Policy Analysis, and Management
Dutch, English, Ancient Greek, History, Economics, Mathematics, Physics

projects.title: Course developer
projects.description: Facilitating the transition of a traditional offline first-year course on Information Literacy and Skills to an online course, using the Open edX platform and technology. The client is Amsterdam Univ. of Applied Sciences.

projects.title: DelftX MOOC Evaluation & Research
projects.description:
TU Delft has been a leader in open education, being one of the first European universities that consistently supported the publication of course materials (Delft Open Courseware), and since 2013, as an active provider of MOOCs on the edX platform. 

Together with Pieter de Vries, I have been responsible for the development of the evaluation infrastructure to evaluate and research the TU Delft MOOCs (Massive Open Online Courses). Between 5000 and 60.000 students sign up for the TU Delft MOOCs (URL: edx.org), and about 30 MOOCs have been developed in the first three years. 

He has a strong research network and his recent publications address topics such as the role of assessment in MOOCs, diversity (gender, culture) in online courses, pedagogy, and collaborative learning.

projects.title: Crowdspace - Startup from #SWAMS 2012
projects.description:
Dit project is gestart om de leegstand in Nederland tegen te gaan. Heeft u een leegstaand gebouw maar geen idee wat u daarmee aan moet? Of heeft een u een prachtig idee maar geen ruimte om dit te realiseren? Via Crowdspace vind U een match! 'Startup Weekend AMS 2012'

Crowdspace has been discontinued.

contributors.headline: creator at What Can I Eat On series
CEO at Sherlocked. Let's make the world more magical.
Full-stack PHP/Laravel Developer at PHPfreelancer.nl, Founder at Alicante Tech Meetup

projects.title: Clavemat
projects.description:
Clavemat is an EU project aimed at improving math education in underdeveloped parts in Latin America, more info on http://clavemat.org. My responsibilities in the project included:
i) Design the project’s pedagogical framework (including teacher training courses, documentation, and videos).
ii) Functional design of the online collaboration and learning environment (based on the Elgg platform) for teachers, students, and mentors, supporting online and blended learning.
iii) Design and co-organize online math courses (miniMOOCs) and pedagogical design of open courseware.
iv) Investigate and design innovative and motivating didactic forms for math education, in particular (alternate reality) games, gamification, and project-based learning.

projects.title: LiLa - Library of Labs
projects.description: “LiLa” is the acronym for the “Library of Labs”, an initiative of eight universities and three enterprises, for the mutual exchange of and access to virtual laboratories (simulation environments) and remote experiments (real laboratories which are remotely controlled via the internet). LiLa builds a portal which grants the access to virtual labs and remote experiments. It includes services like a scheduling system, connection to library resources, tutoring system, and 3D-environment for online collaboration.

projects.title: reAct - reActivating Teachers and Learners
projects.description: The REACT project was an educational innovation and research project based on project-based learning principles, involving international and local collaboration between learners for the development of transversal competences. Various schools and educational institutes from six European countries participated in piloting the approach and integrating principles such as trust, relevance, self-guidance, challenge, creativity, and collaboration in the educational activities. There were successful and less successful pilots (12 in total), but the outcomes were analyzed and provided a rich picture of contextual and pedagogical elements that influence the successful implementation of such an approach and how to address disengaged youth and provide them with the confidence and tools to enable self-directed and engaged learning.

profile_positions.title: Inpakker

profile_positions.description: Innovation partner at design and transition management agency And The People. #circulareconomy #citymaking #climate #andthepeople
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
Coordinating our moonshot project AstroPlant, the open source, citizen science, educational toolkit that makes growing crops on Mars a reality.

A bit of background:
MELiSSA was founded in 1989 to address the challenge to reduce the cargo needed for human missions to the Moon and Mars. The solution to this was conceived as al controlled ecosystem in which plants fulfil several functions: they take up CO2, produce oxygen, contribute to the urine to water cycle, and are a source of nutrients for the humans in the loop.

AstroPlant is a citizen science kit that integrates a simple hydroponics system with an array of sensors, controllable LED system, cameras, and other actuators to generate essential data about plant growth. The data, the designs, hardware, and software are made open source to engage any interested designers, expert, or scientist in the development of the instrument. Scientists at MELiSSA and the European Space Agency use the data in their quest to fully characterise a large number of plant species and cultivars. We’re now working towards integrating the technologies into a low-cost, comprehensive and multi-purpose research instrument for researchers and educators.

AstroPlant is both a science project and an educational project that teaches aspiring young scientists and explorers about space exploration, circular systems design, ecology and biology, plant science, (open source) hardware design, automation and electronics. It also aims to open up plant and agricultural technology and research.
profile_positions.title: AstroPlant Mission Commander

profile_positions.description:
I have been involved in shaping the Circular Economy Strategy for the Municipality of Amsterdam as well as the execution phase - as project manager, policy advisor and trying to be transforming the built environment and food landscape in and around Amsterdam for the better.

Some of the projects include the development and execution of a challenge/prize contest (300k€ budget) focused on circular economy and circular building to bring together relevant stakeholders together, increase open innovation and scalable circular solutions, and support the development of a circular economy in and around Amsterdam. And subsequently organising an innovation programme for social housing organisations in and around Amsterdam in the context of a circular built environment. Impact in several scaled up circular projects addressing circular insulation and renovation concepts, shared mobility, orchestrating value chains around waste streams, and supporting research into circular decision making, financing, and design. From building to area to region.

Member of various circular economy related committees and project groups in and around Amsterdam addressing topics such as entrepreneurship and new business models, food transition, logistics, one-stop-shop for (used/recycled) materials, new products and innovation, and more. Part of the area development policy advisory team, the Amsterdam Food Strategy team, vertical farming working group, short food supply chain working group, and more.
profile_positions.title: Circular Economy project manager and policy advisor

profile_positions.description:
As an independent researcher, I have been involved in setting up and executing research projects in (open) education, including psychological research, gender research, online collaboration, and more. I specialize in MOOC research and creative, technology-enhanced learning, and am particularly interested in self-organization and motivation research, preferably in an action-oriented and innovative setting.

As a consultant, I appreciate opportunities to develop or co-create relevant and innovative solutions, learning materials and setups. Recently, I was involved in the successful authoring of a proposal for a new online learning program about Leadership in a Technological World at Delft University of Technology.
profile_positions.title: Independent researcher/consultant

profile_positions.description: Part of the core team at Border Sessions, involved in programme development and in particular the coordination of the 30+ labs we host on various topics ranging from Artificial Intelligence for Regenerative Ecologies, Ocean Floor Restoration, Low & High Tech Food Lab, and Design for Activism. Also responsible for organising the yearly Border Labs Award for deviant techies with a mission.
profile_positions.title: Programme developer

profile_positions.description: Cirkelmarkt (Circle market) is a social enterprise aimed at local collection and reuse, recycling, or upcycling of waste / raw materials from the 100-yr old Ten Kate market in Amsterdam Oud West. Raw materials are turned into recycled products, such as soap made of orange peels, mushrooms grown on coffee waste, and stools made from recycled plastics, and sold by participating market stalls and retailers. We work with a physical place, the 'waste island', that hosts several recycling machines, and collects and redistributes the waste streams to selected 'circular entrepreneurs'. In addition, we initiate or host design challenges with strategic partners to solve relevant problems.
profile_positions.title: Initiator Cirkelmarkt

profile_positions.description:
My PhD research focuses on the use of web technologies to re-engage at-risk youth into learning. Among other things, it provides a set of guidelines to support the development and implementation of student-centered pedagogy for early school leavers in non-formal education.

My other/previous PhD research projects addressed online reputation, online (learning) communities, self-organization and p2p, and game-based and design-oriented learning approaches.
profile_positions.title: PhD researcher

profile_positions.description: As part of one of our projects in the portfolio (Dutch Coast), I was hired by TU Delft to provide support and facilitate the growth of an online community for PhDs working at TU Delft.
profile_positions.title: PhD Community Manager

profile_positions.description: Organizing a summerschool/workshop for Ph.D. students from different universities of technology in Europe: The first IDEA league SummerSchool about Next Generation ICT.
profile_positions.title: Organizer Summer School

profile_positions.title: Various positions

profile_positions.description:
Ons Dorp Amsterdam (ODA) is a private development initiative, started by 10 families and aimed at development of apartments in a former school in the center of Amsterdam. Completion of the project was in May 2015.

Responsible for the coordination of the design and installation of the sustainability and energy systems. The combination of two PV-systems, high-quality insulation, and heat pump systems (and no gas), resulted in a building that is 85% self-sufficient in terms of energy-use. Founder of the Energy Cooperation "Zon op Ons Dorp Amsterdam" and main negotiator with Amsterdam Municipality Real Estate dept. about the use of roof surface for solar energy production. This negotiation has led to the first such agreement in Amsterdam, and is now a blueprint for future PV projects in the city of Amsterdam.

Also responsible for subsidies and for winning a tender for a 300k€ loan (2% interest) to make the investments in sustainable energy systems possible and financially viable.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability/Energy Coordinator

profile_positions.description: I was involved in the further design and development of the main software called anyMeta, a semantic web platform designed to support online communities. My interests were in the design of features that would enable trust to be formed between participants.
profile_positions.title: Research intern
